thread.title: Agouza & Dokki 'celebrity constituency' sees run-off between 4 candidates - Egypt Elections 2015 - Egypt
thread.title_full: Agouza & Dokki 'celebrity constituency' sees run-off between 4 candidates - Egypt Elections 2015 - Egypt - Ahram Online

author: english.ahram.org.eg
title: Agouza & Dokki 'celebrity constituency' sees run-off between 4 candidates - Egypt Elections 2015 - Egypt
text:
Four candidates are to compete in a run-off for the two available individuals-system seats in the Dokki & Agouza constituency in Giza in the first phase of Egypt's parliamentary elections.
Arabic language media and candidate representatives reported these unofficial results after attending vote-counting at the close of polling on Monday night. The official results are due to be announced the High Elections Committee on Thursday.
Abdel-Rehim Ali got 45,049 votes, followed by Ahmed Mortada Mansour with 24,607, Amr Shobaki who got 19,638 and Sayed Gohar with 10,853 votes.
Ali is a controversial TV host known for attacking 25 January Revolution figures, Mansour is the son of the Zamalek chairman and sits on the board, Shobaki is a renowned liberal political scientist who sat in the 2011 parliament and Gohar is a former-NDP MP who had occupied the Dokki & Agouza seat for 20 years.
The constituency has been described as the "celebrity constituency".
The run-off will take place on 27 and 28 October.
Any candidate needs at least 50 percent of the votes available to them to win an individual seat.
In the list-system voting, the For the Love of Egypt list reportedly won comfortably with 63,440 votes.
Other lists fared less well. Call of Egypt got 7060 votes, Egyptian Front got 4626 and National Awakening managed 1793 votes.
